content:
Here's a seminar ad from Brian Dobbins (bdobbins@ucar.edu), note that it is today

Given how ChatGPT is a frequent topic of conversation, and a number of people in CGD have used it to help with programming questions, I wanted to extend an invite to tomorrow's 2pm CSEG meeting to anyone interested. We'll be remotely hosting Anthony Zhou, an undergraduate with LEAP who worked on a project this summer that looked at using ChatGPT to convert code in the land model's photosynthesis module to Python + JAX. The main questions he was examining were, a) is this useful, and b) how much easier is it when using these kinds of AI tools?

The details are below; feel free to share with others who might be interested. Additionally, these 'guest talks' are something we're aiming to do every month or so; if you wish to be included to them regularly, just let me know and I'll create a 'cseg-guest-talks' alias for that.

CSEG Meeting - Guest Talk: Anthony Zhou
Tuesday, August 22 · 2:00 – 2:45pm
Time zone: America/Denver
Google Meet joining info
Video call link: https://meet.google.com/zyg-pczr-dpe
Or dial: ‪(US) +1 513-818-0859‬ PIN: ‪642 180 020‬#
More phone numbers: https://tel.meet/zyg-pczr-dpe?pin=1803796626803
